content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: TMRPT
      operator: equal_to
      value: Y
    - name: MIDS
      operator: #not suffixed with a sequence number in consistent chronological order
Match Datasets:
  - Name: TM
    Keys:
      - MIDSTYPE
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SDTMIG.CG0546
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: Trigger error when MIDSTYPE=TM.MIDSTYPE and TM.TMRPT=Y and MIDS is not
  suffixed with a sequence number in consistent chronological order
Outcome:
  Message: MIDS is not suffixed with a sequence number in consistent chronological
    order
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Dataset
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0546
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: For types of Disease Milestones that can occur multiple
                  times, MIDS will usually be an abbreviated version of MIDSTYPE and
                  will always end with a sequence number. Sequence numbers should
                  start with one and indicate the chronological order of the instances
                  of this type of Disease Milestone.
                Document: IG v3.4
                Item: Assumption 2.b
                Section: '5.4'
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - SPECIAL-PURPOSE
  Domains:
    Include:
      - SM

json.Description: Trigger error when MIDSTYPE=TM.MIDSTYPE and TM.TMRPT=Y and MIDS is not suffixed with a sequence number in consistent chronological order

Outcome.Message: MIDS is not suffixed with a sequence number in consistent chronological order

Citations.Cited_Guidance: For types of Disease Milestones that can occur multiple times, MIDS will usually be an abbreviated version of MIDSTYPE and will always end with a sequence number. Sequence numbers should start with one and indicate the chronological order of the instances of this type of Disease Milestone.
